message_1: Solve the inequality: 2x + 3 > 7 and graph the solution on a number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 2x + 3 > 7, we'll follow these steps:

1. Subtract 3 from both sides of the inequality:
   2x + 3 - 3 > 7 - 3
   2x > 4

2. Divide both sides by 2:
   2x/2 > 4/2
   x > 2

The solution to the inequality is x > 2.

To graph the solution on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with numbers from -2 to 5 (or any range that includes 2).
2. Place an open circle at 2, because x > 2 does not include the value 2.
3. Shade the region to the right of the open circle, indicating all values greater than 2.

The graph will look like this:

-2  -1   0   1   2   3   4   5
         (------>
         (open circle at 2, shaded region to the right)
